definitions.title: vb. 1.
definitions.body: intrans. slip or drop off; also trans.:

clear away (NH [[נׇשַׁל]] prob. intrans., Qal not used, but n. [[נְשִׁילָה]] a falling off, etc.; Pi. Hiph. cast off, let fall off, Niph. be cast off, fall off; Targum Aph. [[אַשֵּׁיל]] cast out (fr. house); Ar. nasala excidit pluma, etc.; but also trans., avis mutavit rejecitque plumas (Frey);—na4ala celeriter extraxit, etc., is denom. fr. loan-word acc. to Frä:88);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. [[וְנׇשַׁל]] consec. De 7:1 + 2 t.; Impf. 3 ms. [[יִשַּׁל]] De 28:40; Imv. ms. [[שַׁל]] Ex 3:5, Jos 5:15; —
slip or drop off, [[וְנׇשַׁל הַבַּרְזֶל מִן־הָעֵץ]] De 19:5 and the iron slippeth off from the wood (i.e. axe-head from helve); [[יִשַּׁל זֵיתְֶָ]] De 28:40 thine olives shall drop off (abs.).
draw off sandal fr. ([[מֵעַל]]) foot Ex 3:5 (E), Jos 5:15 (JE).

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Impf. 3 ms. [[וַיְנַשֵּׁל]] 2Ki 16:6 he cleared the Jews entirely out of ([[מִן]]) Elath.
